data.title: NASCAR Returns: When And How To Watch The Cook Out 400 At Richmond Raceway
data.meta_description: NASCAR returns with the Cook Out 400 at Richmond Raceway.
data.text:
After a brief hiatus for the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris, NASCAR is preparing for a thrilling comeback with The Cook Out 400 at Richmond Raceway in Virginia.

When to watch NASCAR at Richmond Raceway: The Cook Out 400

The Cook Out 400 is scheduled for Sunday, August 11, at 6 p.m. ET and the highly-anticipated race will air on USA Network.

Saturday, August 10

2.30 p.m. ET: NASCAR CRAFTSMAN Truck Series Practice

3 p.m. ET: NASCAR CRAFTSMAN Truck Series Qualifying

4.30 p.m. ET: NASCAR Cup Series Practice

5.35 p.m. ET: NASCAR Cup Series Qualifying

7.30 p.m. ET: NASCAR CRAFTSMAN Truck Series Clean Harbors 250

Sunday, August 11

6 p.m. ET: NASCAR Cup Series The Cook Out 400

How to watch NASCAR at Richmond Raceway: The Cook Out 400

The Cup Series race will air on USA Network. For those preferring online platforms, a live stream will be available on Fubo, with a complimentary trial option. Additionally, Canadian fans can follow the excitement on TSN.

For those looking to experience the race live, tickets are available for purchase through StubHub or via Richmond Raceway.
